stepAnswer: $$25$$ pounds of nuts, $$5$$ pounds of cereal squares
stepTitle: Orlando is mixing nuts and cereal squares to make a party mix. Nuts sell for $7 a pound and cereal squares sell for $4 a pound. Orlando wants to make $$30$$ pounds of party mix at a cost of $$\$6.50$$ a pound, how many pounds of nuts and how many pounds of cereal squares should he use?
answerLatex: $$25$$ pounds of nuts, $$5$$ pounds of cereal squares
choices: $$5$$ pounds of nuts, $$25$$ pounds of cereal squares
$$25$$ pounds of nuts, $$5$$ pounds of cereal squares
$$10$$ pounds of nuts, $$20$$ pounds of cereal squares
$$20$$ pounds of nuts, $$10$$ pounds of cereal squares
